availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph B. Harper (Louisville, Kentucky, tavern and billiard saloon keeper)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, tavernkeeper. New York native. Married to Margaret C. E. Porter Harper in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on August 1, 1843. Father of Frederick L. Harper, Mary E. Harper, James Harper, Emily L. Harper, Antoinette Harper, and Octavia T. Harper. Tavern keeper in Louisville in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1850. Tavernkeeper in Louisville in 1860. Employed one enslaved person in Louisville in 1860. Tavernkeeper for the Louisville Hotel in Louisville in 1861. Keeper of the St. Charles Billiard Saloon in Louisville in 1865.
